trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Add an Azure AD Tenant as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Add an Azure AD Tenant as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to add an Azure Active Directory (AD) tenant to the list of identity providers in your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to add an Azure Active Directory (AD) tenant to the list of identity providers in your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: This feature allows you to use the tenant as identity provider for applications that are associated with the namespace.
trans-unit.target: This feature allows you to use the tenant as identity provider for applications that are associated with the namespace.

trans-unit.source: The process has two major elements:
trans-unit.target: The process has two major elements:

trans-unit.source: Add the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to the Azure AD tenant to as a web app.
trans-unit.target: Add the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to the Azure AD tenant to as a web app.

trans-unit.source: This allows the namespace (web app) to receive tokens from Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: This allows the namespace (web app) to receive tokens from Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Add the Azure AD tenant to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Add the Azure AD tenant to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: The remaining steps are common to all identity providers in ACS.
trans-unit.target: The remaining steps are common to all identity providers in ACS.

trans-unit.source: You can add relying party applications and rules that determine which identity claims are passed from identity providers to the relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: You can add relying party applications and rules that determine which identity claims are passed from identity providers to the relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: Requirements
trans-unit.target: Requirements

trans-unit.source: The instructions in this topic require the following:
trans-unit.target: The instructions in this topic require the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Getting Started with Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=320795</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Getting Started with Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=320795</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Access Control namespace.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Access Control namespace.

trans-unit.source: For help, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>.
trans-unit.target: For help, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: To add an Azure AD tenant as an identity provider, complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add an Azure AD tenant as an identity provider, complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Find the name of the Access Control namespace
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Find the name of the Access Control namespace

trans-unit.source: In this step, we'll copy the namespace name for use in the next step.
trans-unit.target: In this step, we'll copy the namespace name for use in the next step.

trans-unit.source: You will need the namespace name to indicate that tokens should be sent to the endpoint that receives WS-Federation sign-in responses.
trans-unit.target: You will need the namespace name to indicate that tokens should be sent to the endpoint that receives WS-Federation sign-in responses.

trans-unit.source: Although the namespace URL is in a field labeled <ui>Management Portal</ui>, the tokens are sent to the specified endpoint, not the portal.
trans-unit.target: Although the namespace URL is in a field labeled <ui>Management Portal</ui>, the tokens are sent to the specified endpoint, not the portal.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Application Integration</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Application Integration</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Copy the value of the <ui>Management Portal</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: Copy the value of the <ui>Management Portal</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: The URL in the Management Portal field has the following format:
trans-unit.target: The URL in the Management Portal field has the following format:

trans-unit.source: https://< <parameterReference>Namespace</parameterReference>>.accesscontrol.windows.net/
trans-unit.target: https://< <parameterReference>Namespace</parameterReference>>.accesscontrol.windows.net/

trans-unit.source: Save the value.
trans-unit.target: Save the value.

trans-unit.source: You'll need it in the next step.
trans-unit.target: You'll need it in the next step.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <ui>Management Portal</ui> field is the namespace name and the URL of the endpoint that receives WS-Federation sign-in responses.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <ui>Management Portal</ui> field is the namespace name and the URL of the endpoint that receives WS-Federation sign-in responses.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Add the Access Control namespace as a web application
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Add the Access Control namespace as a web application

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will use the features of the Azure Management Portal to add the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a web application in the Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will use the features of the Azure Management Portal to add the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a web application in the Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: This makes the tenant a recipient of the tokens that Azure AD generates.
trans-unit.target: This makes the tenant a recipient of the tokens that Azure AD generates.

trans-unit.source: Go to the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.windowsazure.com</linkUri></externalLink> and sign in.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.windowsazure.com</linkUri></externalLink> and sign in.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click a directory, click <ui>Applications</ui>, and then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click a directory, click <ui>Applications</ui>, and then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the app.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the app.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>Web Application and/or Web API</ui> (the default).
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>Web Application and/or Web API</ui> (the default).

trans-unit.source: To advance, click the arrow.
trans-unit.target: To advance, click the arrow.

trans-unit.source: In the App URL and App ID URI text boxes, paste the URL that was in the <ui>Management Portal</ui> field on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: In the App URL and App ID URI text boxes, paste the URL that was in the <ui>Management Portal</ui> field on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: To continue, click the arrow.
trans-unit.target: To continue, click the arrow.

trans-unit.source: The App URL is the address to which token are sent when a user authenticates successfully.
trans-unit.target: The App URL is the address to which token are sent when a user authenticates successfully.

trans-unit.source: The App ID URI is the audience to which the token are scoped.
trans-unit.target: The App ID URI is the audience to which the token are scoped.

trans-unit.source: If we used any value other than the <parameterReference>entityID</parameterReference> of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, ACS would be interpret it as a token reused from a man-in-the-middle attack.
trans-unit.target: If we used any value other than the <parameterReference>entityID</parameterReference> of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, ACS would be interpret it as a token reused from a man-in-the-middle attack.

trans-unit.source: When pasting, be careful not to include trailing spaces or extra characters after the final forward slash (/).
trans-unit.target: When pasting, be careful not to include trailing spaces or extra characters after the final forward slash (/).

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, Azure AD will mark the URL as invalid.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, Azure AD will mark the URL as invalid.

trans-unit.source: On the Directory Access page, select the default setting, <ui>Single Sign-On</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the Directory Access page, select the default setting, <ui>Single Sign-On</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Because ACS does not call the Graph API, the setting is not used.
trans-unit.target: Because ACS does not call the Graph API, the setting is not used.

trans-unit.source: To finish the process, click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: To finish the process, click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: At this point, your Azure AD tenant knows about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and can issue tokens for it.
trans-unit.target: At this point, your Azure AD tenant knows about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and can issue tokens for it.

trans-unit.source: On the final page, copy the Federation Metadata URL.
trans-unit.target: On the final page, copy the Federation Metadata URL.

trans-unit.source: You'll need it in a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: You'll need it in a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: To return to this page:
trans-unit.target: To return to this page:

trans-unit.source: Go to the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink> and sign in.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink> and sign in.

trans-unit.source: Click an Azure directory.
trans-unit.target: Click an Azure directory.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Applications</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Applications</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click the application.
trans-unit.target: Click the application.

trans-unit.source: The Federation Metadata URL is also listed on the <ui>App Endpoints</ui> page for the application.
trans-unit.target: The Federation Metadata URL is also listed on the <ui>App Endpoints</ui> page for the application.

trans-unit.source: To view this page, on the Application page, click <ui>View Endpoints</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To view this page, on the Application page, click <ui>View Endpoints</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Add the Azure AD tenant identity provider to the Access Control namespace
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Add the Azure AD tenant identity provider to the Access Control namespace

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will add the security token service (STS) for the Azure AD tenant to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will add the security token service (STS) for the Azure AD tenant to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the ACS Management Portal for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: This action opens the ACS Management Portal for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Identity providers</ui> and then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Identity providers</ui> and then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select WS-Federation identity provider and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select WS-Federation identity provider and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Enter a display name and login link text.
trans-unit.target: Enter a display name and login link text.

trans-unit.source: There are no special requirements for these values.
trans-unit.target: There are no special requirements for these values.

trans-unit.source: In the WS-Federation metadata section, click <ui>URL</ui> and then paste the Federation Metadata URL that you copied from the application page.
trans-unit.target: In the WS-Federation metadata section, click <ui>URL</ui> and then paste the Federation Metadata URL that you copied from the application page.

trans-unit.source: Then, click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then, click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Another useful field on this page is the <ui>Login Link Text</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: Another useful field on this page is the <ui>Login Link Text</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: The value of that field appears in the list of identity providers offered to users when they sign in to the application.
trans-unit.target: The value of that field appears in the list of identity providers offered to users when they sign in to the application.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Use the Azure AD tenant identity provider with your app
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Use the Azure AD tenant identity provider with your app

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD tenant is now registered as an identity provider for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD tenant is now registered as an identity provider for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: In some sense, our task is complete.
trans-unit.target: In some sense, our task is complete.

trans-unit.source: However, in this step, we'll show you how to use the new identity provider by adding it to the offering of identity providers for a web application.
trans-unit.target: However, in this step, we'll show you how to use the new identity provider by adding it to the offering of identity providers for a web application.

trans-unit.source: To select the new identity provider for your app, use the standard procedure:
trans-unit.target: To select the new identity provider for your app, use the standard procedure:

trans-unit.source: Start Visual Studio 2012 and open a web application.
trans-unit.target: Start Visual Studio 2012 and open a web application.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the app name, and then click <ui>Identity and Access</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the app name, and then click <ui>Identity and Access</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the Providers tab, click <ui>Use the Azure Access Control Service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the Providers tab, click <ui>Use the Azure Access Control Service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To associate the app with an Access Control namespace, you need the management key for the namespace.
trans-unit.target: To associate the app with an Access Control namespace, you need the management key for the namespace.

trans-unit.source: Here's how to find it.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to find it.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Management Service</ui>, click <ui>Management client</ui>, and then click <ui>Symmetric key</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Management Service</ui>, click <ui>Management client</ui>, and then click <ui>Symmetric key</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Show Key</ui>, copy the key value, and then click <ui>Hide Key</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Show Key</ui>, copy the key value, and then click <ui>Hide Key</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Now, back in the Visual Studio <ui>Configure ACS namespace</ui> dialog box, enter the name of the Access Control namespace and paste the management key value.
trans-unit.target: Now, back in the Visual Studio <ui>Configure ACS namespace</ui> dialog box, enter the name of the Access Control namespace and paste the management key value.

trans-unit.source: Then, select the Azure AD tenant identity provider from the list of identity providers in the namespace.
trans-unit.target: Then, select the Azure AD tenant identity provider from the list of identity providers in the namespace.

trans-unit.source: When you run the app, a log-in dialog box includes the Azure AD tenant identity provider among the identity provider choices.
trans-unit.target: When you run the app, a log-in dialog box includes the Azure AD tenant identity provider among the identity provider choices.

trans-unit.source: (The name that appears on this page is defined in the <ui>Login Link Text</ui> field on the identity provider settings page.)
trans-unit.target: (The name that appears on this page is defined in the <ui>Login Link Text</ui> field on the identity provider settings page.)

trans-unit.source: Select the Azure AD tenant and then sign in with your organizational account.
trans-unit.target: Select the Azure AD tenant and then sign in with your organizational account.

trans-unit.source: Now, you have access to your application.
trans-unit.target: Now, you have access to your application.

trans-unit.source: The authentication tokens are forwarded to the Azure AD tenant as the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: The authentication tokens are forwarded to the Azure AD tenant as the identity provider.
